intro: [WRONG START] Walenia angulata, commonly known as the angular wallenia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are narrow and angular, giving it its common name, while its flowers are small and yellowish in color. Wallenia angulata is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it adapts well to harsh environmental conditions.
